headline.main: AFFAIRS AT ALBANY.; How They Do It--The Savings Banks' Unclaimed Deposits to be Looked After--The Avenue D Railroad Bill Favorably Reported--A Crack at the Regents of the University--The Bill Providing for the Roasting of the Staten Island Rioters not Recommitted, &c., &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate is not in session to-day, and I am glad of it, for on my word I believe that faithfully reporting their slowness is what makes my letters so stupid. docs.snippet: Mr.REILLY reported favorably from the Committee on the New-York Avenue D City Railroad bill. Mr. COBB noticed a bill for the construction of intersectional railroads in New-York City. BILLS INTRODUCED.

headline.main: Trial of the Staten Island Quarantine Incendiaries.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the Assembly, on Tuesday last, Mr. JOHNSON of Delaware county, gave notice of his intention is introduce the following bill. docs.snippet: Baron Pennafather has resigned his seat on the Irish Bench. The venerable Judge (who was called to the Bar in 1795) has recently been in a very infirm state of health. For Some years the has been deprived of sight, but his wonderful memory enabled...
docs.lead_paragraph: Baron Pennafather has resigned his seat on the Irish Bench. The venerable Judge (who was called to the Bar in 1795) has recently been in a very infirm state of health. For Some years the has been deprived of sight, but his wonderful memory enabled him to discharge his ??dicial daties efficiently, and in latter years some of the heaviest property causes have been tried by him.

headline.main: AFFAIRS AT ALBANY.; Foreign Insurance Companies in the State--Tolling the Railroads--The Sixth City Railroad Project for New-York--Party Discipline Ignored thus far--Propositions of Inquiry after Metropolitan Salaries all Tabled.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the Senate to-day Senator HUBBELL'S bill to amend the statutes relative to Foreign Insurance Companies doing business in this State, was favorably reported from the Committee on Insurance. It requires that one dollar on the hundred on all premiums received by the agent, broker or correspondent, transacting the business of insurance for any Company pot incorporated by the laws of this State,
